Legal_Issue: Whether the Designated Member was required to provide written reasons when granting leave to appeal
Evidence_Assessment: Application lacked required factual allegations and evidence as per Rule 4 of the PAB Rules
Decision_Outcome: Leave to appeal granted without reasons
Legal_Rule: Reasons are mandatory for refusal of leave but not explicitly for granting leave; discretionary decisions should generally be accompanied by reasons
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide written reasons for a discretionary decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Defective application, lack of reasons, absence of formal record
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness compromised due to lack of reasons
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to validity of grant of leave due to procedural defects
Court_Result: Decision quashed, matter remitted for redetermination
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Deficient application lacking factual basis and evidence
Applicable_Process: Appeal process under the Canada Pension Plan
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of the applicant in judicial review
